Emulator Question
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2010 Topics (Year of the Shock Rock): Emulator Question
By The Jokie on Saturday, January 9, 2010 - 10:57 pm:

Hey everyone, long time no talk! Anyway I have a good question. Just recently I started getting into the old MR games. I wanted to play MR2, but I sold my copy of it years ago (stupid), and can't find another copy anywhere. As such I decided to emulate it, but the problem is if I'm running off an ISO I can't use disks from the CD tray. So In reality I can't make anything but Mocchi. I'm using epsxe 1.70 right now, so should I try another program?

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, January 10, 2010 - 10:25 am:

I thought I had read that only one of the many emus worked for shrining on pc. But, I cannot find reference to it.

An alternate way to get some monsters is to use whatever cheat system there is to alter a monster, freeze up two of them and combine them to make one real one. (monsters altered by cheat devices stay the same inside, they just have their skins switched. BUT, once combined the offspring is real)

By Sivart on Sunday, January 10, 2010 - 03:20 pm:

What you can do, using ePSXe, is go to the Shrine, wait for the disc change prompt, and then hit escape, go to File, Run CDROM. After it asks to switch back to the MR disc, go to File, Run ISO. Works for me when I decide I want to play MR2 with no FPS :).

The only problem is that discs with edited sub-codes and such won't work with ePSXe. I ran into that problem quite a lot. Attempting to do so will freeze the emulator.

By Swezlon Uno on Sunday, January 10, 2010 - 10:32 pm:

I use psx, so it may be different, but the same process above works for me, as well.

By The Jokie on Tuesday, January 12, 2010 - 12:29 pm:

thanks guys
